accessibility_text:
Accessibility

Everyone is welcome at the North Carolina Museum of Art.

The Museum seeks to make a safe and welcoming space for all. We work consistently with local partners to gather information on accessibility needs, provide staff training, and increase accommodations during exhibitions and events. [Sign up for our monthly newsletter](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101055547/https://visit.ncartmuseum.org/account/create/brief?_gl=1*1sqmev9*_gcl_au*MTUwOTUwNTcyNS4xNzU5OTM0OTA2LjExMzQ3NzMyNTYuMTc2NTM4MTQxNy4xNzY1MzgxNDE4*_ga*MjA2OTU4MzE1My4xNzYxMjM2Mzg1*_ga_TDKPN4DWNK*czE3NjUzODA0MjckbzYxJGcxJHQxNzY1MzgzNDczJGozNCRsMCRoMA..&queueittoken=e_membercamp2025~ts_1765383657~ce_true~rt_afterevent~h_534c898a0ea7aac3c6966f1d9f8d2cf950c2f5c291468805a53548dda7e83ea1) to be connected to these efforts and receive news about upcoming events. The Museum’s Public Accessibility Policy is available as a [PDF](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101055547/https://ncartmuseum.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/Accessibility-Policy-Update-FINAL.pdf).

The Museum offers a variety of on-site accommodations for visitors with disabilities. Trained service animals such as guide dogs are also permitted in the Museum. If you have questions about our policies or need assistance planning your visit, please email [help@ncartmuseum.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101055547/mailto:help@ncartmuseum.org).

Have questions or feedback about accessibility at the Museum or the accessibility of our website? Please co...
